articles.author: ESPN
articles.title: Olympics 2021 updates - U.S. men's hoops rallies to reach gold-medal game, USWNT seeks bronze, plus more track action in Tokyo - ESPN
articles.description: While the U.S. men's basketball team stormed back to beat Australia and reach the finals, several other Americans stood out on the track -- for good and bad. We have updates.
articles.content: The U.S. men's basketball team trailed by 15 midway through the second quarter of the semifinals of the Olympic Games. But with a gold-medal game appearance on the line, Kevin Durant led the charge.… [+7121 chars]

articles.author: Tom Schad, USA TODAY
articles.title: US men's 4x100 relay team puts in 'unacceptable' performance, fails to qualify for Olympic final - USA TODAY
articles.description: Team USA has a history of relay mishaps, from lane violations to poor handoffs. Thursday was no different as the Americans were sixth in their heat.
articles.content:
TOKYO – Team USA arrived in Tokyo with three of the fastest men in the world in the 100 meters this year, making it a heavy favorite to win the men's 4x100 relay.
Instead, in a stunning development,… [+4220 chars]

articles.title: Delta Pushes Herd Immunity Threshold To Above 80%: Experts - NDTV
articles.description: The spread of the delta coronavirus variant has pushed the threshold for herd immunity to well over 80% and potentially approaching 90%, according to an Infectious Diseases Society of America briefing on Tuesday.
articles.content:
Nearly 60% of Americans have received at least one dose of a coronavirus vaccine

articles.title: Tom Walsh takes bronze in Olympic shot put final - TVNZ
articles.description: Walsh finished behind American rivals, Ryan Crouser in first, and second-placed Joe Kovacs in a repeat of the Rio podium.
articles.content:
Tom Walsh has claimed the bronze medal in the men's shot put final this afternoon at the Tokyo Olympics.
Tom Walsh throws during the shot put qualification at the Tokyo Olympics.

articles.title: WHO Wants Moratorium on Booster Shots Until Low Income Countries Catch up - Voice of America
articles.description:
The World Health Organization’s director-general is calling for a worldwide moratorium on COVID-19 booster shots until at least the end of September, to allow low-income nations to get more initial vaccination doses.
